comments: Since A(n,7) = A(n+1,8), A(n,7) gives essentially the same sequence.The next term (A(17,8)) is known to be at least 64 and at most 72.
references: A. E. Brouwer, J. B. Shearer, N. J. A. Sloane and W. D. Smith, New table of constant weight codes, IEEE Trans. Info. Theory 36 (1990), 1334-1380.
J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 248.
F. J. MacWilliams and N. J. A. Sloane, The Theory of Error-Correcting Codes, Elsevier/North Holland, 1978, p. 674.
P. R. J. Ostergard, On the Size of Optimal Three-Error-Correcting Binary Codes of Length 16, Preprint, Jan 11 2011.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: S. Litsyn, E. M. Rains and N. J. A. Sloane, A(n,d) tables.
N. J. A. Sloane and D. S. Whitehead, A New Family of Single-Error Correcting Codes [Shows a(18) >= 36.]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Error-Correcting Code.
Index entries for sequences related to A(n,d)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
